items.content_html: It happened slowly, but preferred music playback device size and wire count have gone up for me over time. 2010: iPod Shuffle. 2017: iPad Air 2 & Oppo HA2-SE.

My wife and I are really enjoying ‚ÄúThe Great British Bake Off‚Äù, ‚ÄúThe Marvelous Mrs. Mazel‚Äù, and ‚ÄúThe Good Place‚Äù lately. It is still really hard to watch anything with a baby in the house, though.

Dear Apple Music: Just because I listened to Sixpence Non The Richer‚Äôs cover of ‚ÄúThere She Goes‚Äù (originally by the La‚Äôs, and arguably about heroin, for goodness sake), doesn‚Äôt mean I want to listen to Christian music in all my personalized mixes. üôÑ

So far the snowfall hasn‚Äôt been so bad‚Äîonly a few inches so far. It is windy, though, and very cold. My daughter, home on a snow day, is watching ‚ÄúFrozen‚Äù, which is apt. I am turning my attention to hot tea and (less hot) database programming.
Blog post: Picking a great writing font. Do you like good writing fonts? I‚Äôm loving Plex Mono and iA Duospace right now.
I hope I set up mirroring to GitHub correctly. It is a geeky feature, for sure, but I‚Äôm not 100% sure if I set it up correctly.

We are bracing for a blizzard tonight, which is expected to snow us in all day tomorrow. School is canceled already. (Work isn‚Äôt.) I feel like it is a metaphor for what‚Äôs going on in my life right now. (Photo is historical.)

It looks like I will be doing some C# coding for work this month. That stuff is more interesting than the database stuff I do, and far more rewarding than the VBA stuff I have to do sometimes. I wish I could use Swift instead, though.
I like TweetBot a lot more than I like Twitter.
It must be January 2, because I just created a literal ‚ÄúLaundry List‚Äù in Reminders.
